pylovo

  • process_editor.js
  • View page source

process_editor.js

fetchProcessProfiles()

retrieves pre-existing process property data from the pandapower2urbs templates in the backend

createProcessJSONTemplates(processes, process_commodities)

creates dict entry templates to use if we want to add new processes or new process commodities

Arguments:

  • processes (dict) – dict with process feature:value key:value pairs

  • process_commodities (dict) – dict with pro_com feature:value key:value pairs

populateProcessEditorList(htmlListName, listEntries)

we create options with text based on the keys of a dict and attach them to a html select

Arguments:

  • htmlListName (string) – id of the html select element we want to add options to

  • listEntries (dict) – dict containing data for all options we want to add

fillSecondaryEditorList(target_properties)

called at runtime to make sure only the correct elements are displayed in the pro_com_prop list. All options whose names are keys in target_properties are made visible, all others are hidden The pro_com_propSelect element technically contains options for all commodities added to all processes, but we hide all options not added to the currently selected process

Arguments:

  • target_properties (dict) –

openNewProcessForm(isCommodity)
Arguments:

  • isCommodity (bool) – determines whether the process creation dialogue or the pro_com_prop creation dialogue is opened

closeNewProcessForm(isCommodity)

onclick button for the forms’ cancel button, closes dialogue window and resets all input fields

Arguments:

  • isCommodity (bool) – determines which form needs to be closed

newProcessFormVerifyInputs(sel)

onchange function for the input fields of the process creation popup form makes sure “Create Process” button is disabled until all inputs are set correctly

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – the commodity select element

processAddCommoditySelection(sel)

onchange function for the input fields of the popup form for adding a commodity to a process makes sure “Create Process” button is disabled until all inputs are set correctly

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – the commodity select element

openSecondaryProcessEditor(sel, secondaryFeatureName)

Function makes secondary feature window visible and fills all input fields with the saved values, if any exist. At the moment the process editor is the only one with a secondary editor, namely the pro_com_prop editor

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – gets passed as “this” reference when the onchange method for the select element is called, needed to retrieve the currently selected secondary feature

  • secondaryFeatureName (string) – key for relevant html elements

createNewProcess()

onclick function of the “Add Process” button. Calls helper function that adds process to process list and pro_conf table as well as attachment of process commodity

addCommodityToProcess()

adds process commodity to the pro_com secondary feature editor and calls function creating a new commodity, if the user chooses to create an entirely new commodity to attach to the process

createNewProcessProperty(name)

creates a new process and adds it to the ProcessObject & html pro_prop select

Arguments:

  • name (string) – name of the new process

createNewProcessCommodity(pro_name, com_name, inOrOut)

we must add a newly defined process commodity to the list of commodities, the process_config table and the editor window of the process the commodity is associated with

Arguments:

  • pro_name (string) – name of the process the commodity is attached tos

  • com_name (string) – name of the new process commodity

  • inOrOut (string) – type of the new process commodity

writeBackProcessFeatures(target, isPro_com_prop)

saves edited feature in the ProcessObject

Arguments:

  • target (event_target_object) –

  • isPro_com_prop (bool) –

createPro_ConfEditor()

sets up pro_conf handsontable table in the GUI
